title: Arpeggio: 13th in G# (Shape: G)
content:
# Arpeggio: 13th in G# (Shape: G)

## Description:
An arpeggio is a musical technique where notes in a chord are played in sequence, instead of simultaneously. The 13th arpeggio adds the 1st, 3rd, 5th, 7th, 9th, 11th, and 13th notes of a scale to create a full, rich sound.

## Notes and Intervals:
- G# (1st)
- B# (3rd)
- D# (5th)
- F## (7th)
- A# (9th)
- C## (11th)
- E# (13th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor:
The 13th arpeggio, especially in the key of G#, can be found in various styles of music including jazz, R&B, and soul. It adds a lush, sophisticated quality to chord progressions, creating a sense of tension and resolution.

## Songs:
1. **"Misty" by Erroll Garner**: This jazz standard features the 13th arpeggio prominently in the piano accompaniment, adding a dreamy and romantic feel to the music.
2. **"Adorn" by Miguel**: In this R&B hit, the 13th arpeggio is used in the keyboard parts, enhancing the sensuality and groove of the song.
3. **"Let's Stay Together" by Al Green**: The 13th arpeggio can be heard in the background of this soul classic, contributing to its timeless and soulful sound.
